messages.text: I can usually add withing minutes. But sometimes the JC storage servers can't keep up with new things and then there will be a backlog. In particular when some huge jll package is merged. Perhaps that happened now?

curl

messages.text:
Why hasn’t Automerge ran for 26 minutes?
<https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/actions?query=workflow%3AAutoMerge+event%3Aschedule>
Doesn’t it run every 12 minutes?

elements.text: Why hasn’t Automerge ran for 26 minutes?
Doesn’t it run every 12 minutes?

messages.text: sometimes it skips runs, often they start with some delay.  github :shrug:

elements.text: sometimes it skips runs, often they start with some delay.  github

messages.text: Should we up its frequency?

elements.text: Should we up its frequency?

messages.text: I'd prefer actions to actually respect the scheduled times... I don't mind a few minutes delays, but skipping runs seems not ideal

elements.text: I'd prefer actions to actually respect the scheduled times... I don't mind a few minutes delays, but skipping runs seems not ideal

messages.text:
Sure, if they respected the times that would be Ok.
(12 minutes is a bit long for my taste but only by 2 minutes)
but since they don’t respect the times, then as a hack making it try more often might work?

elements.text:
Sure, if they respected the times that would be Ok.
(12 minutes is a bit long for my taste but only by 2 minutes)
but since they don’t respect the times, then as a hack making it try more often might work?

messages.text:
<https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/actions/reference/workflow-syntax-for-github-actions#onschedule>

> The shortest interval you can run scheduled workflows is once every 5 minutes.
12 minutes should be ok, but...

elements.text: The shortest interval you can run scheduled workflows is once every 5 minutes.
12 minutes should be ok, but...

messages.text:
Do we actually need to use a scheduled job for this in the first place?
Can’t we make it automerge on CI completion?

messages.text:
after yesterdays release I got
```Triggering TagBot for merged registry pull request

This extra notification is being sent because I expected a tag to exist by now, but it doesn't.
You may want to check your TagBot configuration to ensure that it's running, and if it is, check the logs to make sure that there are no errors.```
from TagBot (<https://github.com/kalmarek/Cyclotomics.jl/issues/9#issuecomment-749509414>) and the release was not created; I did create tag manually, but maybe there's a better way to solve it?

I think we should change automerge to happen as soon as it passes.
While the delay has some positive features, it being unreliable is too problematic.

messages.text:
Not having frequent automerges is really frustrating.
Because if you are waiting for a release, to e.g. make a follow up release on a downstream package, or to tell a users that opened an issue "it is now fixed and releases", then waiting >10 minutes really messed with the flow of your day.
Especially if it's the last thing you want to do before you finish work.
You don't really want to leave these things for the next day since you're livable to forget things.
Just in general context switching sucks.
Having to come back to a thing much later requires context switching
